loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en: Mohammed is 29 years old and lives in Sana'a, Yemen. He has worked very hard to get ahead and to improve his business. He has been operating a home products business. It is his main source of income. This loan is the second one funded by Kiva. He said his business started to improve but is experiencing increasing prices from the market where he purchases. He received lower income and profits, so he has applied for a youth loan of 300,000 YER from AMB to buy home products to sell in his business. He thanks Kiva for financing him, and he wishes to continue to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy home products for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy organic manure for his banana farm.

loans.name: Marie Jean

texts.en:
Marie Jean is 37 years old and lives in Pob 4 Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has two school-age children. Marie Jean has a sari-sari store, and she earns approximately PHP 25,000 each month doing this type of business.

She has a requested a loan to purchase inventory for her general store, such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap, and other consumable products. Marie Jean has been a member of PMPC for five years. Marie Jean hopes to improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her general store, such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap, and other consumable products.

loans.name: Flavia

texts.en:
Flavia is 17 years old and lives in the town of Seeta, in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past two years, Flavia has been working hard to manage her tailoring business. 

To help expand her business, Flavia has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more material for making school uniforms and other clothes, and will help Flavia to generate greater profits and take good care of herself. Flavia hopes that in the future, she will be able to build a house. 

Flavia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.


"

loans.use: to buy more material for making school uniforms and other clothes

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam lives in Msambweni. She is divorced and has one child who is a grown-up. She is the owner of a well-stocked coconut store which she has had for over twenty years. Thanks to this business and the work of the entire family, they have been able to grow considerably and are continuing to grow. They want to be able to expand their shop until they have a large supermarket where they offer comfort to their customers.

Mariam is seeking this loan for the purchase of sacks of coconuts in order to be able to keep providing a good variety to her customers since that is what draws them the most.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan, es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en un cuarto alquilado pequeño y con el piso de tierra, la casa está ubicada en la zona Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja como empleado en una empresa privada por más de ocho horas al día ya que con lo que gana debe pagar los gastos de alimentación, alquiler y pago de servicios básicos.
El crédito lo requiere para el pago de la universidad ya que actualmente estudia marketing y así podrá mejorar sus ingresos cuando se gradue.
El sueño de Juan, es ser profesional y vivir en una casa en anticrético para mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en: Juan, who is single and has no children, lives in a small rented room with a dirt floor.  The house is situated in the Sopocachi district of La Paz.  He currently works for over eight hours a day as an employee in a private company because his earnings must cover his food, rent and basic services.  He is currently studying marketing so as to improve his earnings when he graduates and, therefore, he needs this loan to pay his university fees.  Juan's dream is to be a professional and pay a fixed sum for his room instead of monthly rent and, thereby, improve his quality of life.  This is the first time that he has applied for a loan with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to pay his university fees as he continues his marketing course.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 36 years old, married, has two children and lives in Likoni, Kenya. Together with her husband, she runs a food cafe where they prepare and sell food. This is a business she has been running for the last four years. She has been able to get a number of regular consumers thanks to the delicious meals her husband cooks and the good relationship she has with her customers. 

She has approached us with a loan request amounting to KES 30,000 so as to buy bundles of wheat and maize flour and cooking oil. She is grateful for the opportunity.

loans.use: to buy bundles of wheat and maize flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Evance

texts.en:
Evance is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business. He has been operating this business for the last four years. His major monthly expenditure is paying school fees. 

Evance sells goods like soap, shampoo, canned goods, spices, maize and wheat flour. He also sells newspapers.

Evance has approached for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to pay school fees for his children. He is grateful for the opportunity.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Mabula Group

texts.en:
Steveni, who is in his mid-30s, is married with two children of whom one goes to school and the remaining is still too young. He originally had a general store but switched to a grocery business two years ago now. He works from 4pm to midnight daily and is able to earn a good profit per month.

This will be his 9th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to open the grocery business, covered school fees and household expenses. He has paid back all his loans successfully. He will use this loan to increase more grocery stocks. His dream is to one day be able to expand his business.

Steveni will share this loan with his loan group " MABULA" which totals 14 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more grocery stocks.

loans.name: Kijoli

texts.en:
Kijoli is a hard-working entrepreneur, who has a food vending business in Likoni. She is borrowing KES 20,000 through Yehu Microfinance Trust to purchase ingredients for her food preparation and sales business. Kijoli has been in this business for two years, and she earns additional income from her general store.

Kijoli has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from Yehu Microfinance Trust. She dreams of saving money, to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food preparation and sales business.

loans.name: Ngati

texts.en: Ngati is a 41-year-old man who is married with six children. He lives in Tiribe, Kenya. He runs a retail business selling electronic examples of phones, televisions and accessories. He has been doing this for the last two years which has helped him to gain a wide variety of customers. He is requesting a loan for 30,000 Kenyan shillings to restock the business and buy more accessories. He plans to use the extra revenue generated by the loan to secure a better future for his children.

loans.use: to restock the business and buy more accessories

loans.name: Sinaraha

texts.en: Sinaraha is single and has three school-age children. She is engaged in buying and selling dried fish in their village to generate income to help her family. She aims to improve the business and increase her income in order to cover their necessities and support the education of her children. In this regard, she is asking for a loan of 20,000 KES to buy additional stocks of dried fish and fish sauce to sell. She is hoping that this loan will help her improve the business and that it will be more profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of dried fish and fish sauce to sell.

loans.name: Ndinda

texts.en:
Ndinda has proved to be a very hardworking and determined woman. She is grateful to Kiva for her previous loan, which helped her improve her business income.

Ndinda is requesting another loan to be able to cater to her increasing customers who always flock to her cafe. She is requesting KES 25,000 to buy two bags of maize, one bag of beans, rice, cooking fat and other foodstuffs to enable her to serve more customers.

loans.use: to buy two bags of maize, one bag of beans, rice, cooking fat and other foodstuffs

loans.name: Qodir

texts.ru: Кодир житель района Зафаробод. Ему 50 лет. Он женат и отец двоих детей. Кодир добрый, отзывчивый человек. Он занимается животноводством уже 5 лет. Кодир покупает и перепродает крупно-рогатый скот. В его деле ему помогает семья. Кодир хочет увеличить поголовье скота и берет кредит для закупа коров и телят.
texts.en: Qodir lives in the Zafarobod region.  He is 50 years old and is married with two children.  Qodir is a kind, responsive person.  He has been involved in raising cattle for five years.  He buys and sells cows to support his family.  Qodir wants to increase his head of cattle and he is asking for a loan to buy cows and calves.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Herine

texts.en:
Herine is an industrious business lady, aged 33 years old and married to Walter who is a farmer. They have three children, aged ten, seven and three. She runs a fruit and vegetable business and has been in the business for the last three years earning a monthly income of about KES 11,000.

She learned about KADET LTD from fellow women in the market who are already registered and funded by KADET. She has acquired a first loan of KES 20,000 which she will use to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

She plans to use her anticipated profits to meet the family's basic needs. Her dream is to attain financial sustainability.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 34-year-old, married woman living in Msambweni, Kenya with her husband and their five children. Their children range in age from six to 22 years old; four of them are in school, while the youngest son has yet to enroll in school. Her major monthly expenditures are school fees for her children.

She is a hardworking businesswoman who owns and operates a cereal kiosk. At the kiosk she sells ground nuts, coconuts, maize, wheat, and peas. 
She been in this business for the last five years, which has helped her attract regular customers. Indeed, she explains that her customers prefer to shop at her kiosk because she always has the products they need at affordable prices, and also because she provides excellent service. 

She is very dedicated to her work, energetic, and has many goals for the future. Her secret to success is consistency and a love of the work she does. She believes that anyone can achieve what they want through hard work. She is now seeking a loan in the amount of 25,000 KES because she needs to restock her kiosk with sacks of maize, beans, and peas. She is grateful to the lenders.

loans.use: to expand and improve her business by purchasing additional sacks of maize, beans, and peas

loans.name: Hemed

texts.en:
Hemed is a 50-year-old married man living in Msamweni, Kenya in his own house together with his 10 children  and husband. He owns a tailoring shop, which he had been running for the last four years. Due to his experience, he has improved his customers services.
 
He is asking for a loan of KSH10,000 to buy new garments and materials to mend more clothes for his customers.

loans.use: to buy new garments to mend more clothes

loans.name: Mwagomba

texts.en:
Mwagomba is married and is from Tiribe, Kenya. He is the owner of a store at the market. With regular customers, he also makes deliveries on his motorcycle. He sells spare parts. He is a hard worker whose goal is to be able to keep growing to be able to continue helping his family and to take care of the day-to-day expenses.

He is requesting a loan of Kes 5,000 to add up on his savings to be able to invest in the purchase of supplies for his store and thus continue working and earning more.

loans.use: to purchase supplies of spare parts for his store

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 34 years old and married. He supports a family of five children as well as other four adults who depend on him. His spouse runs a small horticulture farming business which helps in producing some additional income.  

Samuel runs a leather products shop in Kabarnet, where he sells a variety of leather products, i.e. shoes, whist belts, leather handbags, among other items. He has been in business for the last 10 years, and his monthly income from the business is 60,000 KES (Kenyan shillings).

He has borrowed a fourth loan of KES. 100,000 which he intends to use to purchase more stock of leather, shoelaces, leather glue and bins for making shoes and other leather items. He plans to use the additional income to expand the business and save some to educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of leather, shoelaces, leather glue and bins for making shoes and other leather items.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 51 years old. She is married to Stephen and they have two children who are all in school. They live in Nyahururu town.

This is her second loan from KADET LTD after successfully completing her previous loan. She will used the money to purchase more assorted cereals for sale. She hopes to start selling her cereals wholesale in the near future and also improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase more cereals to sell

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice lives in Likoni area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has two school-going children. She owns a retail shop, a business which has been running for six years. The shop mainly sells tea leaves. She also sells fish and has formal employment.

Eunice learnt about Milango through friends who invited her to the group, and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are price fluctuations. 

Eunice is applying for a loan of 53,800 Kenya shillings (KES) to add retail and food stock, e.g., tea leaves and fish. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve on the living standard of her family and pay school fees for her children. She looks forward to owning a whole sale shop.

loans.use: To add retail and food stock, e.g., tea leaves and fish.

loans.name: Marima

texts.en:
Marima a 37-year-old woman and lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well known markets in Montserrado county. She did not attend school but she said she is good at managing her home affairs and business. Marima is single with two children aged 12 and 14 who are attending school and lives at home. 

For the past years she has been selling soft drinks, cold water, biscuits, cookies, and juice in the local market. The problem she faces sometimes is slow business, but most of the time she realizes profit and uses it to sustain her family. She is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks, cold water, biscuits, cookies, and juice her business. 

She hopes to build a house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks, cold water, biscuits, cookies, and juice for her business.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is 22 years old and lives in Magibi county which is the largest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. She is married with two children, ages 2 months old and 8 years old; one is currently in school and they all live at home. For the past six years Hannah has been selling red oil in the market. She enjoys the profit-making in the business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more red oil for her business. Her plans are to build her house and send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more red oil for her business.

loans.name: Biasha

texts.en: Biasha is 43 and married with six children, all of whom are still in school. Biasha lives in Likoni, Kenya with her family. Her major monthly expenditure is school tuition. She owns a fish stall where she buys fish from fishermen and sells to her customers by going house to house. She has now gained a large enough customer range that she wishes to buy fish in larger scale. It is for this reason that she has requested a loan amounting to Ksh 15,000. She is grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy more fish for her fish selling business.

loans.name: Mwanaharusi

texts.en:
Mwanaharusi is a 27-year-old hardworking married lady with two children. She lives in Likoni, Kenya in a rental house with her husband. Their major monthly expenditure is school fees for her children, who are both in school.

Mwanaharusi runs a business selling water. Due to increased demand, she wants to buy a bigger water pump. This is why she has requested a loan amounting to KES 35,000. She is grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy a bigger water pump

loans.name: Ronard

texts.en:
Ronard is 47 years old, married and has four children. He does welding and has been in business for the past seven years. He also runs a tailoring shop. He is a very hardworking and diligent man. 

Thanks to Faulu Kenya he has learned how to save his money for future purposes. 

He wishes to expand his business. He wants a loan of 106,600 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy fabric.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose, 32 years old, is married with four children and is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a charcoal and hand bag selling  business. She buys bags in large scale at cheaper price and sells them at a retail price. This is a business she has been doing for the last two years.

In her business she has been selling hand bags for ladies, but due to demand from her regular customers she has decided to include men's bags. She has therefore approached Yehu Microfinance Trust for a loan amounting to 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy men's bags for resale and add stock of charcoal. From the increase in profit she will improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy men's bags and add stock of charcoal for resale .

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.ru: Баходур житель города Душанбе. Ему 33 года. Он женат и отец троих детей. Баходур работает поваром. Он арендует столовую, где готовит различные национальные блюда и предоставляет их посетителям. Сейчас Баходур хочет расширить свою деятельность. Он запрашивает кредит на сумму 2000 долларов. На полученный кредит он собиратеся сделать ремонт в столовой и увеличить ассортимент блюд.
texts.en: Bahodur lives in the city of Dushanbe.  He is 33 years old and is married with three children.  He works as a cook; he rents a cafe where he prepares an assortment of national dishes and sells them to his patrons.  Now Bahodur wants to expand his business, so he is asking for a loan of 2,000 dollars.  On receiving this loan, he plans on making repairs to his cafe and expanding his assortment of dishes.

loans.use: to make repairs on his cafe.

loans.name: Celene

texts.en:
Celene is 29 years old and a motorcycle owner who operates a transportation business in Majaoni, Mombasa. She is married and together they support two children. She has been in this business for the past eight years and has done great. 

She will use the requested loan to diversify her business operations by opening a retail shop which will form her secondary income generating business. She hopes the business will be able to generate profits which she will use to repay her loan. This is her third loan. 


The previous ones were paid successfully. She hopes to grow her businesses in different towns.

loans.use: To fund a new business - a retail shop.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene is now 50 years old, and has been doing well since her second loan which helped her to renovate her rental houses. She has put up a retail shop and hopes this business will grow to enable her to open up a wholesale shop, and eventually a supermarket in the future.

loans.use: to renovate her rental houses

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a resident of Malindi, Kenya. She previously applied for a loan which was fully repaid in order to have a new schedule, favourable to her. She therefore requested another loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to buy additional stock of clothes and school fees. She believes this investment will help her meet the family's needs.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and also to pay for her child’s fees.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew, a 39-year-old farmer, lives in Kitale county, Kenya, with his wife and two children, both in school. He has been farming for the past seven years, producing milk, eggs, tomatoes, maize and beans, which he sells at the local market.

Andrew is requesting a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry birds. He will sell the products and earn extra income to help uplift his livelihood and to pay for his children’s schooling. 

Andrew's major farming challenges are poor transport networks and high competition. He aspires to have two thousand poultry birds in the next five years.

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Jenneh

texts.en:
Jenneh is 47 years old and lives in Kakata, the capital city of Margibi County and the area with the highest production of rubber in Liberia. She is a widow with three children between 20 and 32 years old; only one child lives at home and is in school. 

For 10 years, she has been selling rice and fish in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her sister and learned this trade from her friends. She spends nine hours on her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice and fish for her business. She hopes to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more rice and fish for her business.

loans.name: Abdurahim

texts.ru: Абдурахиму 54 года. Он женат и имеет троих детей. У Абдурахима высшее образование. Он работал военным 24 года. А последние 4 года он занимался торговлей. Сейчас Абдурахим хочет начать новый бизнес. Он запрашивает кредит для открытия продуктового магазина. За счет прибыли он хочет улучшить финансовое положение семьи.
texts.en: Abdurahim is 54 years old and he is married with three children.  He has a higher education and he worked as a soldier for 24 years.  For the last four years, he has been a shopkeeper.  Now he wants to start a new business, so he is asking for a loan to open up a grocery store.  With the income from this business, he hopes to improve the financial situation of his family.

loans.use: to open a grocery store.

loans.name: Eutimia

texts.en:
Eutimia is 60 years old, a widow with an only daughter who is now studying and they are recently residing in Canal, Siquijor.

She has been engaged in this business for seven years and earns five thousand pesos a month to cover their living expenses.

She has been a PMPC  member for a couple of months and now she has requested a loan amounting to three thousand pesos to  purchase some food ingredients.

loans.use: to purchase some food ingredients

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is a widow with two  children. Isabel is 63 years old and lives in Imelda, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Isabel runs a 'sari-sari' (variety) store to earn a living and had this business for two years. Each month, she earns 3000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase  items such as shampoos, toothpaste, soap and others for her general store business.

Isabel has been a member of PMPC for  years. In the future, Isabel hopes to expand her store.

loans.use: to purchase items such as shampoos, toothpaste, soap and others for her general store

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 29 years old and a business lady; she is single. She is blessed with two children. Beatrice has been selling second-hand clothes and shoes for the past four years with a monthly income of KES. 30,000 which she uses to provide for her children.

Beatrice is applying for her first loan term with KADET LTD. She will use the loan to buy more stock of shoes for sale. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will open another shoe outlet. Her hopes and dreams are to have a mega shoe shop in Runyenjes Embu town.

loans.use: To buy more shoes for sale.

loans.name: Maia

texts.en:
Maia is 43 years old and comes from Vani district, West Georgia. She is married and lives with two sons and a daughter-in-law. His son is a chef at a local restaurant and gets a monthly income. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a greenhouse, where different kinds of vegetables are grown and a vineyard with 2500 grape vines. They sell the harvested products and grapes locally. 

Maia is a very hard-working woman and has a rich experience in her business. She requested a loan for purchasing a milk cow. After purchasing a milk cow, Maia will produce dairy products to sell. This will increase the income of the family. With increased income, they will be able to improve their living conditions. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Muqadas

texts.ru: Мукадас проживает в районе Спитамен. Ей 34 года. Она замужем и имеет троих детей. Ее муж занимается бизнесом и в данный момент находится в Российской Федерации. Сама Мукадас занимается животноводством уже более 5 лет. Она покупает крупно-рогатый скот, откармливает его и затем перепродает. У нее имеется 0,30га земли, где она выращивает сельхозкультуру для корма скота. Сейчас Мукадас хочет расширить свою деятельность. Она запрашивает кредит в размере 2000 долларов для закупа крупно-рогатого скота и в дальнейшем его купли-продажи.
texts.en: Muqadas lives in the Spitamen region.  She is 34 years old and she is married with three children.  Her husband is currently working in the Russian Federation.  Muqadas has worked in cattle raising for more than five years; she buys cattle and fattens them up for resale.  She has .3 hectares of land where she grows the crops she needs to feed the cows.  Now Muqadas wants to expand her business.  She is asking for a loan of 2,000 dollars to buy cows for future resale.

loans.use: to buy cows for resale.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is married with six children. Cecilia is 63 years old and lives in Abanil St. Aguada, Ozamiz City.

Cecilia is an entrepreneur and manages her "carenderia" (cooked food stand) to earn a living. She has been doing this for six years with the help of her partner. She has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase more stock for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap and other consumable products. 

Cecilia has just joined PMPC this year. In the future, Cecilia hopes to expand her "carenderia" store and to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap and other consumables

loans.name: Halfan

texts.en: Halfan is 26 years old and married with one child. He lives in Mwambalazi, Kenya with his family, his wife and child. He owns a retail shop where he sells milk and bread, etc. He has requested  a loan amounting to Ksh.30,000 to buy a refrigerator to keep the milk fresh.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator to keep the milk fresh.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria, 37 years old, has been married to a farmer for almost 18 years, and even though they don't have children, they focus their lives on business and on farming. Victoria has raised hogs for almost 10 years. She would like to take a loan for PHP 35,000 to purchase hog feeds and hogs to raise. She's hoping that her loan request will be granted, so that her business will become larger and more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase hog feeds and hogs to raise.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna has run her fruit and vegetable stall for six years. According to her, she is able to earn about PHP 7,000 a month. She uses this income towards their household expenditures, children allowance and monthly payment for her stall. Aside from vending fruits and vegetables, she also raises two sow and ten hogs to be fattened.

Edna struggles with a shortage of capital due to the expensive cost of livestock supplies for her hogs. She is asking for financial assistance of PHP 13,000.This will be used in buying stocks of banana and different kinds of vegetables such as carrots, cabbage, potatoes and onions. She believes that her business growth relies on her wise management and perseverance.

loans.use: to buy stocks of bananas and different kinds of vegetables for her fruits and vegetables stand.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 19 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, Agnes has been working hard to manage her small market, which sells raw foods.

To help expand her business, Agnes has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more raw food such as bananas and cassava to sell, and will help Agnes to generate greater profits and provide for her basic needs. Agnes hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land.

Agnes is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more raw foods such as bananas and cassava to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy one milk cow and two cattle.

loans.name: Narantsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Narantsetseg is 30 years old, and lives with her husband and son in a ger (traditional, round, felt tent) in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her husband, Togoonyam, age 31, works at a mining company, as a driver. Her son, Altanbagana, age 6, goes to a local kindergarten.

Borrower has been running various kinds of business over the years and has obtained a lot of experience and regular customers. She has been running a grocery store business since 2010. Now, she is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase inventory for her grocery store, in expectation of increased demand during Lunar New Year. She is a hard-working, welcoming, and modest woman.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for her grocery store, in expectation of increased demand during Lunar New Year

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is from Msambweni; she’s a very hardworking person who has always worked and striven to reach her goals and objectives. She owns a grocery store in downtown Msambweni; she’s had it for years and comments that it’s attained good renown in the neighborhood, and thanks to that she has a good clientele. 

Stella defines herself as a person who always strives to the maximum to attain what she wants. She is asking for this loan to buy tomatoes, peppers, onions, chicken, rice, and other products to stock her store and have good products to offer her customers. She is grateful for this opportunity she’s getting that will help her very much.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, peppers, onions, chicken, and rice

loans.name: Dynna

texts.en:
Dynna is 33 years old, married, and has two kids who are school-aged; they are presently residing at Candura, San Juan, Siquijor.

She has been engaged in this business for five years and earns 3000 pesos a month to provide for their needs.

She has been a PMPC member for a couple of months now, She requested a loan amounting to 9,000 PHP to purchase feed and piglets.

loans.use: to purchase  feed and pigs

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 30 years old and is now applying for a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She opened her kiosk one year ago with her own working capital of $700. She earns a good income from her business.
She will use her loan to buy some stocks to keep in her store such as soft drinks, beer, noodles, eggs, bread, milk and rice. She wants to make her business larger and improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to buy in additional stock for her kiosk.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis, es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en la zona de Pampahasi en una casa ocupando solo dos habitaciones pequeñas en la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito lo requiere para pagar un curso de actualización en seguridad ciudadana, ya que trabaja en una universidad privada dictando clases sobre seguridad, y este curso le será de mucha ayuda en su trabajo. Ya que con los ingresos que tiene debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación, pago de servicios y también ayuda a uno de sus sobrinos en el pago de sus estudios.
El sueño de Luis, es tener su casa propia ya que desea tener más seguridad y comodidad para poder acoger a su familia cuando llegue el momento de formar una.
Es la primera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Luis is single and has no children. He lives in La Paz, Pampahasi area, in a house where he only uses two small rooms.

Luis is requesting a loan to pay for a course to update his knowledge of "citizen safety." He teaches courses on safety in a private university, so this course will be beneficial for his job. With the income he receives, besides paying for his food and for the utilities, he helps a nephew to pay for his studies.

Luis’s dream is to have his own house; a safer and more comfortable place to have a family, when the moment to have one arrives.

This is his first time with IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: to pay for a course needed for his teaching activities in a local university.

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
Luzmila de 29 años está casada con Erminio con quien tiene 2 hijos , juntos tienen una casa propia que se ubica en un anexo agrícola.Ella es jovial y carismática, características que hacen más llevadero su trabajo. Su principal actividad es la agricultura. Ya lleva como 10 años de experiencia en la siembra de arvejas, habas, papa, maíz y hortalizas. “Mis terrenos están lejos, me demoro como media hora para llegar”, menciona. A pesar de eso, Luzmila, con la constancia que la caracteriza, todas las mañanas sube muy contenta a cuidar de sus cultivos, con la ayuda de su esposo y de peones que le ayudan en tiempos de cosecha.
Cuando esto sucede, ella traslada sus productos hacia el mercado mayorista de Tarma para asi proceder con sus ventas. Este último año, sus hijos le exigen más cosas por sus estudios. Ella recurre a su banco comunal para solventar sus principales necesidades. 
Éste mes es importante, tiene que cultivar y esparcir fertilizantes en algunos cultivos. Así también tiene que iniciar siembras . Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Muruhuay”, y éste sería su crédito número 6 con MFP. Se siente identificada con el grupo a tal punto de ser la tesorera, por esa razón se compromete en ser puntual en los pagos de sus cuotas.
Destinará los 1500 soles en la compra de semillas y fertilizantes para iniciar siembras de maíz, avena y arvejas.
texts.en: Luzmila is 29 and married to Erminio, with whom she has 2 children.  They have their own home in a farm outbuilding.  She is cheerful and charismatic, qualities which make her work more bearable.  Her main business is agriculture and she has ten years' experience of growing peas, beans, potatoes, corn and vegetables.  "My land is quite a distance away, so it takes me about half an hour to get there" she observes.  In spite of this, every morning, Luzmila, with her customary perseverance, goes very happily to tend her crops, with the help of her husband and farm labourers who help at harvest time.  While this is going on, she goes to sell her produce at the wholesale market in Tarma.  Over the last year, her children have made more demands on her for school-related materials and so Luzmila has turned to her communal bank to cover her main needs.  This month is important as she has to do some planting and spread fertiliser on some crops, as well as having to begin sowing.  She is a member of the "Señor de Muruhuay" communal bank and this would be her sixth loan with MFP.  So strongly does Luzmila feel part of the bank that she has become its treasurer and, for that reason, she guarantees that she will make her repayments punctually.  She will spend the 1500 soles on seeds and fertiliser to begin growing corn, oats and peas.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertiliser

loans.name: Binta

texts.fr: Madame Binta  est une résidente d e l’une des localités villageoises du Sénégal. Elle est mariée et s’active dans le secteur du commerce depuis plus de 10 ans dans le petit commerce et la petite restauration.  Elle gère une buvette ou elle exerce en même temps la vente de pain. Elle est sociétaire  des guichets de l’UIMCEC ou elle a déjà remboursé 9 crédits antérieurs, Elle sollicite un crédit d’un montant de 100.000 francs CFA prévu pour l’achat de pain et de condiments  utilisé pour les besoins de sa buvette. Elle envisage de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. Son projet dans le futur est de disposer d’un grand magasin de commerce et pouvoir diversifier les produits qu’elle commercialise.
texts.en: Ms. Binta is a resident of a village in Senegal. She is married and has been active in business for over ten years working in small-scale commerce and in selling prepared foods. She runs a refreshment stand, where she also sells bread at the same time. She is a partner at a U-IMCEC branch where she has already repaid nine previous loans. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 100,000 francs CFA for purchasing bread and some condiments for use at her stand. She envisions satisfying the demands of her customers. For the future, her plan is to own a large store and to be able to diversify the products she sells.

loans.use: to purchase bread to sell and some condiments for her refreshment stand

loans.name: Eve

texts.en:
Eve is a 26-year-old married woman. She has two children, ages 3 and 7 years. She describes herself to be honest, God fearing and a focused woman. She operates a retail store  where she sells cosmetics such as hair weaves, lipstick, hair oil, etc. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her primary customers are local residents. 

Eve describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate stock of cosmetics to sell . She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy cosmetics to sell. Her business goal is to improve her business performance with a goal of operating with a capital of Kes 100,000 within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children with profits from the business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en: Ivan is a resident of Kakiika, a suburb in Mbarara municipality. He completed the university with a degree in computer science in 2008. Since he has never gotten any employment opportunity, he was forced to start up the secretarial bureau so as to earn a living. The business is running with inadequate capital thus he is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda shillings to buy a printer and photocopying machine so as to increase his capital for more profits. This will help him to get more income to support himself and his dependents in the form of tuition as well as other costs of living.

loans.use: To buy a printer and a photocopying machine

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.fr:
Jean Claude est motard.  Il est marié, âgée de 30 ans et a 5 enfants dont le plus âgé a 7 ans et le moins âgé a 2 mois. Un de ses enfants va à l’école et aucune autre personne n’est en sa charge.
Il n’est au Rwanda, son niveau d’éducation est 2 ans de l’école primaire.  
Il a commencé de collaborer avec ACB Ltd en 2012 et  est au premier cycle crédit.
Avec le crédit demandé, il va acheter la moto qu’utilisera en transport rémunéré des personnes.
L’accident, la maladie ou la panne irréparable sont les difficultés de non remboursement de ce prêt qu’anticipe Monsieur Jean Claude.
Pour accroitre son activité, il a la stratégie de travailler beaucoup d’heures par jour et beaucoup de jours par mois. L’ambition pour son activité est d’avoir et conduire la voiture et faire le commerce. Pour sa famille, il a l’ambition d’éduquer ses enfants, construire sa propre maison et assurer le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Jean Claude is a motorbike driver. Aged 30, he is married and has five children, of whom the oldest is 7 years old, and the youngest is 2 months old. One of his children goes to school. Jean Claude has no other persons to support. 

He was born in Rwanda and has a 2nd grade education. He started collaborating with ACB Ltd. in 2012 and is now on his first loan cycle. With the loan requested, he is going to purchase a motorbike that people will use for paid transport. Accidents, illnesses, or breakdowns beyond repair are the difficulties anticipated by Mr. Jean Claude for not repaying this loan. 

To increase his business, he has a strategy to work long hours. The ambition he has for his business is to own and drive a car and to work in commerce. For his family, his ambitions are to educate his children, build his own house, and ensure his family's well-being.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for transporting people who can pay

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 37 years old and an industrious businessman who is married to a university secretary. He is a father of two school-going boys aged 12 and eight years respectively. He operates a busy clothing stall dealing with the sale of second-hand clothes, earning a monthly income of KES. 15,000. He learned about KADET LTD from a business colleague who is a registered member of KADET LTD.  

He has acquired a first loan of KES. 25,000 which he will use to purchase and transport bales of second-hand clothes from the port to his premises for sale.

He plans to use the anticipated profit to expand his business as well as pay school fees for his children. His dream is to own a residential plot in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bales of second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:
Celsa is married with six children. Celsa is 57 years old and lives in Imelda, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

To earn a living, Celsa has a computer shop. She had this business for four years. Each month, she earns approximately 8000 PHP. 

Celsa has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Celsa hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to pay for computer maintenance

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.en:
Hanifa is 18 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past one year, Hanifa has been working hard to manage her piggery business, which sells pigs. 

To help expand her business, Hanifa has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more pigs to sell and will help Hanifa to generate greater profits and support her family with their basic needs. Hanifa hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Hanifa is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more pigs to sell

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is 52 years old. She is divorced and has three kids. She prepares all kinds of fast food that she later sells in a small restaurant from home. 

Rukia gets up very early every morning and is at work. Her work day extends into the early evening, and she works every day of the week. For her, there are no holidays, nor rain days.

Although there are other restaurants located close to her, Rukia explains that her stall attracts more clients because the food she sells is hygienically prepared, looks great and tastes delicious.

She started this business more than three years ago, and when it went well, she decided to stay with it and it has been growing little by little ever since. In addition to the food she also does farming. She needs a loan with which to buy cases of beverages. Buying in bulk will allow her to buy at a considerable discount, and she wants to build up a good stock of beverages as the demand for cold beverages is high.

loans.use: buy beverages in wholesale quantities.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
El señor Jesus vive en casa propia con su esposa en la zona de Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz.

Jesus, de profesión administrador de empresas, percibe una renta de jubilado de una de las escuelas culinarias donde trabajo durante muchos años; vive con su esposa sus hijos son independientes.
El crédito que solicita es para pagar los costos de la instalación de gas a su domicilio; por el carácter social califica para un crédito.

El sueño de Jesus fue sacar profesionales a sus hijos y darles una vida comoda lo cual lo logró.

Es la primera vez con IMPRO  y la primera vez que es parte de KIVA,
texts.en:
Jesus lives in his own home with his wife in the area of Sopocachi, in the city of La Paz.

Jesus is a business administration professional and receives a retirement income from one of the culinary schools where he taught for many years.  He lives with his wife; their children are independent.

The loan he is requesting is to pay the costs for the installation of gas in his home; his socio-economic status qualifies him for a loan.

His dream was for his children to become professionals, and to be able to give them a comfortable life, which he achieved.

This is his first time with IMPRO and the first time he is a part of Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for the installation of gas to his home, which will reduce his monthly gas payments.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Madame Fatou  vit  dans l’une des localités villageoises du Sénégal. C’est une femme mariée  qui fait du commerce dans le but de pouvoir contribuer  à la gestion des charges  familiales  plus précisément   la dépense quotidienne. Elle exerce la vente de tissus depuis plus de 30 ans. Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’UIMCEC  et sollicite un crédit de 150 000 prévu pour l’achat de tissus qu’elle va revendre. Elle a déjà remboursé un crédit antérieur.  Son objectif consiste à vouloir développer son activité de commerce et accroitre ses gains. De ce fait son financement servira à renforcer son fond de roulement et acheter des tissus qui seront destinés à la vente. Elle désire satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle et acquérir  d’autres marchés pour mieux rentabiliser son activité. Elle rêve de pouvoir voyager dans le futur  pour importer les tissus  qu’elle vend.
texts.en:
Ms. Fatou lives in a village in Senegal. She is a married woman who does commerce in order to help manage family expenses, that is, day-to-day expenses. She has been selling cloth for over thirty years. 

She is a member of a U-IMCEC branch and is requesting a loan of 150,000 [francs] for purchasing cloth she is going to resell. She has already repaid a previous loan. Her goals include wanting to develop her commerce and to increase her profits. And so, her financing will serve to bolster her working capital and to purchase some cloth for resale. 

She would like to satisfy the demands of her customers and to acquire other markets, so as to make her business more profitable. For the future, she dreams of being able to travel to import cloth for her to sell.

loans.use: to purchase cloth to resell

loans.name: Bulbul

texts.en:
Bulbul is 50 years old. She is married and has a 26-year-old son. She is working as a cleaner and her husband is an electrician, and both family members get a small monthly salary. The family is involved in agricultural business. In particular they own a plot of land where they grow different kind of vegetables, fruit and citrus. They have been  involved in this business for 20 years and are very experienced in this field. The family does all relevant agricultural work to insure a good quality of harvest. 

Harvested products are sold at the local open market. With the requested loan, Bulbul plans to purchase bee hives with bee colonies. The family members will sell the produced honey for a good price and they will increase their family income. The increased profit will be reinvested in the same business and Bulbul will be able to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase bee hives with bee colonies

loans.name: Marvelline

texts.en:
Marveline is a 33-year-old shopkeeper, she is married to Kelvin. They are blessed with two children. She has been selling green grocery items and charcoal for the past five years with a monthly income of KES. 50,000. She uses this to support her family.

Marveline is applying for her first loan with KADET LTD. She will use the loan to purchase more stock of charcoal to sell.
With the anticipated profits from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build a home for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Suyumkan

texts.ru: Суйумкан 35 лет, не замужем, у нее есть одна дочка 5 лет. В качестве источника дохода для семьи, Суйумкан занимается реализацией продуктов питания. Начатое в 10 лет назад с 2,000  KGS сом бизнес на сегодня приносит около 10,000сом (KGS) в месяц. На данный момент у Суйумкан имеется очень развитый бизнес. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Суйумкан обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение товарооборота продуктов питания в магазине. Так как увеличение ассортимента и количества товара на витринах магазина позволит увеличить доходы. Доходы Суйумкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение торгового места и товарооборота. Мечтает сделать ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Suyumkan is 35 years old and not married. She has a daughter aged 5. As a source of income for the family, Suyumkan sells food products. Having been started with 2,000 som (KGS) 10 years ago, the business today brings in around 10,000 som (KGS) per month. Currently Suyumkan has a very developed business.

With an aim to further develop her business, Suyumkan turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 70,000 som (KGS) to increase the turnover of food items in her store. Because increasing inventory will help her realize higher profits. Suyumkan plans to invest the income in further expanding her retail space and the product turnover. She dreams of refurbishing her house.

loans.use: To purchase an inventory of food items and increase the turnover of goods in her store

loans.name: Chynar

texts.ru: Чынар 46 лет, замужем, воспитывает 1 сына ему 15 лет. В качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, Чынар с 2000 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 20,000 сом (KGS). В хозяйстве Чынар на сегодняшний день имеется 4 коровы и 10 овец. что приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц с продажи молока и молочных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Чынар обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят и одну дойную корову. Доходы от кредита Чынар планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства. Планирует построить сарай.
texts.en: Chynar is 46 years old, married and is raising her 15-year-old son.  As the main source of income for her family, Chynar has worked with livestock since the year 2000.  She began her business with the sum of 20,000 KGS.  Thanks to her guidance, today the business has 4 cows and 10 sheep, and brings in around 10,000 KGS a month from the sale of dairy products.  With the goal of growing her business further, Chynar has turned to the company Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 100,000 KGS to purchase calves and a milk cow.  Chynar plans to use the profits from the loan to further expand her livestock.  She also plans to build a shed.

loans.use: To purchase calves and milk cows

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 18 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past year, Patricia has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, soap, milk, bread and juice.

To help expand her business, Patricia has requested a loan of 250,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities like milk, bread, sugar and soap for resale, will help Patricia to generate greater profits and support her family with the basic needs and save some of the money for future use. Patricia hopes that in the future she will be able to own a whole sale shop.

Patricia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities like milk, bread, sugar and soap for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy leather, shoe laces and thread to make shoes.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en: Florencia has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than 20 years now. They live in Bohol, Philippines with their two children. Florencia is requesting a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, buckets, and fuel for the boat. With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Florencia hopes to make their fishing business successful and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, buckets, and fuel for the boat

loans.name: Delma

texts.es:
Delma es casada y vive ahora en casa de sus suegros con su esposo y sus dos hijos. Ella ahora es comerciante y trabaja alrededor de 12 horas al día junto a su esposo. Los ingresos que tiene muchas veces no son suficientes y en esta época de lluvia su hogar sufrió algunos destrozos por lo que es necesario hacer una refacción para que no empeoren las cosas.

Es por eso que necesita el crédito para comprar arena, cemento, estuco, para arreglar las paredes de un par de habitaciones que necesitan meantenimiento que pueda solucionar el problema de su casa lo antes posible.

El sueño de Delma es poder hacer crecer su negocio y dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Delma is married and now lives in her in-laws' house with her husband and two children.  She is now a vendor and works around 12 hours a day with her husband.  The income that she has is often not sufficient.  

In this rainy season, her home suffered some damage, which is why it is necessary to make some repairs so that things don't get worse.  This is why she needs the loan to buy sand, cement and plaster to repair the walls in a couple of the rooms that need maintenance.  This can solve the problem in her house as soon as possible.

Delma's dream is to be able to grow her business and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement and plaster to repair the walls in a couple of the rooms in the house where she lives.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 30 years old, married, and has two children, ages 7 and 1. She has a grocery business in Tala town where she sells potatoes, vegetables, onions, tomatoes, and fruits such as bananas, oranges, and mangoes. She has had this business for the past year, and it has been profitable.

This is her first loan term. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more grocery goods such as potatoes, vegetables, bananas, oranges, and mangoes. She also plans to buy more tomatoes and onions. She anticipates generating more income, which she will use to buy more items such as rice and beans for resale. She will also use a portion of the income to pay school fees for her child.

Irene hopes to expand her business by renting a stall in the market, as this will enable her to sell more grocery items, as well as to make more income.

loans.use: To buy more grocery goods.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a 24-year-old married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be a persistent and focused woman. She operates a food stall  where she sells snacks, tea, and food. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located at a viable business area, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy food ingredients for preparing meals to sell. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients for preparing meals

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie, 35 years old, lives in Airport in Magibi county, which has the largest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. A married mother of five children between the ages of 18 years and 6 months, all but the infant currently in school, Marie had to end her education in 4th grade.

For the past 15 years Marie has been selling body cream, powder, spray, and bath soap, having started this enterprise with a small amount of money provided by her husband. She learned this business from her aunty, and enjoys the enthusiastic response of her customers. Marie is requesting a loan to purchase more body cream, powder, spray, and bath soap, and hopes to earn more profit to sustain her family.

loans.use: to purchase more body cream, powder, spray, and bath soap for her business.

loans.name: Mauricio

texts.es:
Mauricio tiene 50 años de edad, tiene dos hijos. Desde hace 16 años se dedica a la pesca y desde hace cinco años administra su propia tienda. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar el equipo de pesca; ya que por problemas de salud de su hijo lo tuvo que vender. Ahora, él necesita adquirirlo nuevamente ya que es otra fuente de ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Mauricio is 50 years old and has two children.  For the past 16 years, he has made a living fishing, and for the past five years, he has been managing his own store.

The loan he is applying to Fundación Campo for, is to buy fishing equipment, since he had to sell his due to his son's health problems.  Now, he needs to buy it again since it is another source of income for his family.

loans.use: to buy fishing equipment.

loans.name: Ugul

texts.en: Ugul is a widow and has two children. She always wanted to provide them with good living conditions and since her husband died, Ugul decided to start a new business buying and selling dried fruits in order to generate an income to contribute to her home’s finance. She has some cows but her income from this business is small. She studied the course of ‘To get ahead’ at the women's organization and got enough business skills. Her children will help her with the business. She will be a very successful business woman as she is hardworking and smart. She is asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni to buy dried fruits for the new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy dried fruits for the new business

loans.name: Andrei

texts.ru:
Андрей уже один раз обращался к КИВА за финансовой помощью. Он сделал отопление во всех теплицах, поставил большие котлы, вследствие чего увеличился доход с огорода. Когда в прошлом году у Андрея пропали огурцы на втором урожае осенью, его семья практически ничего не заработала и понесла убытки. Поэтому Андрей и обратился за кредитной помощью снова. 
В этот раз дополнительные средства в размере 20 000 гривен необходимы Андрею для того, чтобы закупить уголь. Закупив уголь, Андрей сможет отапливать все теплицы и надеется пораньше получить урожай.
texts.en:
Andrei has already come to Kiva for financial assistance.  He installed heat in all his greenhouses, as well as added large planters with the goal of increasing the profits from his garden.  Last fall, Andrei lost his crop of cucumbers, and his family lost practically all their income.  Because of this, Andrei took out a loan to help his situation again.  

At this time, Andrei needs an additional sum of 20,000 UAH to buy coal.  With this coal, Andrei will be able to heat all his greenhouses and he hopes to harvest early.

loans.use: To buy coal to heat all his greenhouses

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a man of 35 years, married to Purity, and the father of three children. He hawks household items, like door mats, water glasses, and so on. He has been in this business for ten years and earns a monthly income of 25,000 Kenyan Shillings.

This will be Peter's second loan with KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to buy more household products, like water tumblers, mugs, and hotpots, for resale. He wants to buy a vehicle in the future.

loans.use: To purchase water tumblers, mugs, thermoses, and the like

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en: Sonia is applying for a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is running a business in front of her house, doing car services. She is making a good income from car services. She wants to use the loan funds to buy more stock and to pay the mechanic who works for her. She is living in a town near the main road, so many people come to have their cars fixed at her place. She opened her business one year ago with her own working capital, $400.

loans.use: to buy items needed for repairing cars to have in stock, and to pay the mechanic who works for her.

loans.name: Nugzar

texts.en:
Nugzar is 44 years old. He is a married man and lives in a small village in Mtskheta District with his wife, two children and his mother, who is provided with a retirement pension. Nugzar’s daughter is a student and his son goes to the local school. The family is busy with agricultural activities. They have a pig and sell piglets seasonally. The family has a poultry farm as well and sells chickens. Nugzar works hard to do his best for the family.

He requested a loan to expand his poultry farm. He plans to purchase eggs and a poultry generator (when the power goes out, the farmers rely on backup power systems to protect their animals) After the eggs are purchased, chicks will be hatched and they will be sold with a price mark-up after several months. This will increase the income of the family. With increased income they will be able to expand their agricultural business in order to make it more profitable. Living conditions of the family will be improved.

loans.use: to purchase eggs and a poultry generator

loans.name: Narine

texts.en:
Narine lives in Yerevan with her husband and a child. She teaches at a local school and, together with her work, also studies at Goris State University, in the department of part-time studies. 

Narine specializes in pedagogy and is in her third course of study. Unfortunately, her salary as a teacher is only enough to cover her family's basic costs, so it is very hard for Sona to pay her university tuition fee.

Narine has applied for this loan to pay for her university tuition and complete her education. It is very important for Narine to get high education and continue her work as a teacher.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru: Мавлуда живет с родителями в городе  Дангара. Ей 23 года. Она еще не замужем. Мавлуда занимается вышиванием женских национальных одежд и принимает заказы у себя дома. Она работает портнихой уже 4 года. Мавлуда просит кредит на сумму 1500 TJS, чтобы купить новую швейную машину и расширить свою деятельность.
texts.en: Mavluda is a resident of the city of Dangara.  She's 23 years old and she's not yet married.  Mavluda has practiced embroidery of the national dresses and works from home. She's worked as a seamstress for 4 years.  Mavluda has turned to us to take out a loan of 1500 TJS so she can buy a sewing machine and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Mikheil

texts.en:
Mikheil is 30 years old. He lives in a small village of Mtskheta district with his parents and sister. 

Mikheil is involved in the agricultural business. In particular, he has 12 pigs and sells piglets seasonally. Besides, he has a vineyard and produces wine and vodka to sell locally. 

Mikheil is very hardworking young man and has a rich experience in his business. He decided to build a greenhouse and requested a loan. After building a greenhouse, Mikheil plans to grow cucumbers and tomatoes, which will be sold locally. 

This will increase the income of the family and they will be able to improve their living conditions. Mikheil awaits your support.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 21-year-old single man from Lebanon. He is living with his parents and seven siblings. In 2009, in order to supplement the family's income, he decided to start his own business. His job consists of distributing tobacco. He works on a free-lance basis and wishes to open his own shop. He has a wide range of clients asking for his products. 

This is why he's asking today to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to prepare the legal registration papers that will allow him to open his own shop. This will certainly increase the demand for his products and facilitate his work as well; especially since it wouldn't be necessary for him to visit his customers at their places. In the future, he plans to take more Kiva loans and expand his business as much as he can.

loans.use: to prepare the legal registration papers that will allow him to open his own shop

loans.name: Hicham

texts.en:
Hicham is a 48 year old Lebanese man. He's married. He lives with his wife and two school-aged children. He's a friendly and above all hardworking man. He started his business many years ago; he owns a clothing shop where he sells a wide diversity of dresses, t-shirts, pants and many other items. He has also a tailoring machine in case some of the items needed any modification. People in his town and the surrounding areas are sure that he can offer them high quality designs at fair prices. 

In order to provide the family with extra financial support Hicham requested a loan from Kiva Partner Vitas s.a.l. to increase his merchandise of dresses, pants and many other items. He seeks to open his own tailoring factory as soon as he can, hoping to enhance his family's way of living.

loans.use: to increase his merchandise of dresses, pants and many other items

loans.name: Ngao

texts.en: Ngao is 40 years old. He is married and has four children. He lives in Mwambalazi, Kenya, with his family. He is in business, buying and selling goats. He has been doing this for the past three years. This experience has helped him improve his weakness and maintain his strengths. He has approached Yehu Microfinance Trust with a loan request, in the amount of KES 20,000, to buy goats for resale.

loans.use: to buy goats for resale

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a 50-year-old, married man. He has four children, whose ages range from 17 to 24 years. He describes himself as a polite and focused man. 

He operates a construction business. He has been involved in this business for 24 years. His business is located at a potential business area that is developing, and his customers are primarily local residents. He says his biggest business challenge is delays of payment by his customers, for work he has done.

Francis will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy iron sheets. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. He managed to repay his previous loan of KES 20,000.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets

loans.name: Kavumbi

texts.en:
Kavumbi is 63 years old, married and a mother of six children. For the last two years, she has earned a living by selling fruits and vegetables from her food kiosk in Malindi. Kavumbi earns a monthly income of KES 14,400 from the business. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and is applying for her second loan of KES 60,000 to buy additional stock for the business such as tomatoes, pineapples, oranges, and onions to sell to her customers.

Kavumbi will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay for her children's school fees as well as expand the business. Her goal for the future is to continue growing the business so that she may uplift her family's financial stability.

loans.use: to buy additional stock such as tomatoes, pineapples, oranges and onions to sell

loans.name: Tarek

texts.en:
Tarek is a 32-year-old married Lebanese man living with his wife. They cooperate together, wishing to improve their financials and build a beautiful family with children. Tarek is the one responsible for covering the family expenses. As for Farah, his wife, she's a teacher and has many years of experience in this domain. 

Tarek has owned a call center and OMT (online money transfer) shop; he also sells bags and accessories. Today, he's looking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to enlarge his business by purchasing some products such as recharge cards and other needed items. This will boost his sales thus his profits. In the future, he plans to take more Kiva loans and better develop his work.

loans.use: to enlarge his business by purchasing some products such as recharge cards and other needed items

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia's interest is in cooking viand (tasty dishes) and other kinds of delicacies. She really enjoys her food production sales business; she has operated in this field of business for four years.

According to her, she is able to produce ten kilograms of frozen foods and 500 pieces of packed candies a day. Leticia has been a widow since 1999; she is thankful because during those mournful days in her life, she has been able to raise her children well.

Due to the many orders, Leticia would like to increase the frozen foods she offers, but her capital is insufficient.  

She has decided to ask for a loan of PHP8,000. She will use this loan to buy frozen foods such as tocino (a type of bacon), sausage, and hotdogs, as well as ingredients for her homemade candies such as polvoron (similar to shortbread), pastillas, and tamarind (a local fruit) candies.

Leticia hopes for the further growth of her business so she could gain better income to sustain her basic needs, and to stabilize her food production sales.

loans.use: to buy frozen foods such as tocino, sausage, hotdogs and ingredients for her home made candies such as polvoron, pastillas, and tamarind.

loans.name: Rejoyce

texts.en:
Rejoice is a 26-year-old business woman who sells different kinds of soft drinks. She is married to Daniel, a 30-year-old teacher. They have two children. 

She joined ID Ghana in 2010, when she needed capital to buy more goods to meet customer demand.

She has been in this trade for four years, and still doing very excellent in the Dansoman community. She is very hardworking and industrious. 

This is her 5th loan with ID Ghana, and she needs a loan of GHS 800 to buy more goods to meet demand.

loans.use: To increase her soft drink inventory for her customers.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 23-year-old single Lebanese man. He lives with his parents and only one sibling. Ali wishes to offer his family a respectable life, far from problems and difficulties. For this reason, he combines forces to be able to afford the heavy life expenses. He opened his own butchery in 2010. He's a reputable person who always searches to deliver for his customers good and fresh products. 

Today, he's asking for a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to renovate his butchery and renew his tools. In that way, he will be able to develop his business and augment his sales. In the future, he plans to raise cattle and start his own dairy products trading business as a parallel job.

loans.use: to renovate his butchery and renew his tools

loans.name: Maimie

texts.en: Maimie is 31 years old and lives in Magibi county, which is the largest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. She has four children between 3 weeks old and 16 years old, three of whom are attending school and live at home. Her husband is a businessman. For the past eight years, she has been selling slippers in the market. She is respected in her family and a mother of a supportive home. One of the problems she is facing is that she doesn't have a good location for her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more slippers for her business. Her plans are to expand her business and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers for her business.

loans.name: Nawale

texts.en:
Nawale is a 47-year-old Lebanese single woman. She is living on her own. 

Nawale has been working as a private teacher since 2010. She likes her profession because she feels that she is helping learners to get the needed education. She started teaching from home until she decided to apply for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to arrange a special teaching room and equip it with the needed supplies. 

Nawale notes that these purchases will facilitate her work preparation, allowing her to expand her research and studies. She is very optimistic about her future and wishes to receive more students with the coming school season.

loans.use: to arrange a special teaching room and equip it with the needed supplies.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 33 years old and married with two children, both of whom attend school. 

Fatuma operates a small stall that she opened in the market; she sells all kinds of products including lettuce, tomatoes, onions, carrots, etc. She has been in retail businesses for six years. 

She has very good sales, thanks to the location of her stall. People come to the market every day to buy necessities, while others that work in the area come to eat lunch in the market's restaurants.

Her work day begins at 5 AM daily, to be ready to open the stall at 6 AM. 

She needs a loan to be able to stock the stall with more seasonal products such as onions, potatoes, and tomatoes, along with eggs and chicken.

loans.use: to stock the food stall with more seasonal products, such as onions, potatoes, tomatoes, eggs, and chicken.

loans.name: Jamirah's Group

texts.en:
Jamirah's group is composed of two hardworking women. Jamirah is 17 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. 

For the past two years, Jamirah has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells soap, bread, milk and cooking oil. 

To help expand her business, Jamirah has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities like milk, bread, sugar and soap for resale. This will help Jamirah to generate greater profits and take good care of herself, buy new clothes, and pay for her medical bills. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to build rental houses of her own. 

Jamirah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities like milk, bread, sugar and soap for resale.

loans.name: Edina Kiden

texts.en:
Edina is a 35-year-old businesswoman who lives in Yei. She is married and has four children between the ages of 3 and 11. All of them go to school.

Edina runs a general store and has been in business for four years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. She is taking a loan of 4,000 SSP to purchase sugar, tea leaves, onions, and many other items. In addition to this business, she has no other source of income.

In five years Edina would like to expand her business. Her major challenges include high prices in the market.

Edina says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more items like sugar, tea leaves, soap, etc.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.es:
Cynthia, de 25 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, . Es soltera y vive en la casa de sus padres en compañía de sus 2 hermanos de 18 y 17 años de edad respectivamente.La a actividad que realiza Cynthia es la venta de abarrotes de primera necesidad, para eso cuenta con una bodega que instaló en la casa de sus padres, donde atiende muy amablemente a sus clientes que en su mayoría son su vecinos y ha sabido ganarse sus preferencias por el buen trato que les brinda.
Se inició hace más de 02 años con un préstamo de MFP  , ella considera a su negocio bastante rentable pues sus productos son de primera necesidad . Antes de empezar con su actividad, no tenía problemas, pero si los deseos de generase sus propios ingresos y apoyara a su padres con los gastos del hogar. 
Por tanto, viendo los buenos resultados que está teniendo, tiene deseos de continuar con su negocio e incursionar en otro negocio de venta de ropas, pues ha visto que es bastante rentable.
Este será el préstamo número 05 con MFP Y está contenta de saber que contará con el apoyo financiero para avanzar con su negocio por esta razón solicita 2000 nuevos soles, los cuales  invertirá en la compra de abarrotes en general tales como arroz, azúcar, huevos, harina, etc. para asi surtir su negocio y tener un stock variado disponible para su venta.
texts.en:
Cynthia is 25 years old.  She is a hardworking and enterprising woman.  She is single and lives in her parent's house along with her two brothers who are 17 and 18 years old.  Cynthia works selling basic grocery items.  She has a small store that is located in her parent's house.  She kindly serves her customers, who are mainly neighbors, and she has earned their loyalty because of the good treatment she provides.

She started more than two years ago with a loan from MFP.  She considers her business to be profitable because the products she sells are necessities.  Before she started her business, she did not have problems, but she wanted to earn her own income and support her parents with the household expenses.

Seeing the success that she is having, she wants to continue with her business and move into another business selling clothing since she has seen that it is profitable.  

This will be her fifth loan with MFP and she is happy to know that she has the financial support to advance with her business.  She is requesting 2000 nuevos soles to invest in the purchase of groceries in general such as rice, sugar, eggs, flour, and other items to stock her business and have varied merchandise available for sale.

loans.use: to purchase groceries.

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es:
Juan Pablo es soltero y vive en casa de su madre en la zona Central de la ciudad de La Paz. Trabaja como cajero en una institución financiera, y durante las noches estudia para poder terminar su carrera.

El crédito lo solicita para gastos universitarios de post grado ya que su sueldo no le alcanza para todos sus gastos y con mayor educación podrá acceder a un mejor trabajo.

El sueño de Juan Pablo es terminar sus estudios e independizarse para que su mamá pueda vivir un poco más tranquila y él poder ayudarle.
texts.en:
Juan Pablo is single and lives in his mother's house in the central area of the city of La Paz.  He works as a teller in a financial institution and studies at night to be able to finish his education.

He's requesting the loan for graduate study expenses because his salary is not enough to cover all the expenses.  With more education he'll be able to move up to a better job.

Juan Pablo's dream is to finish his studies and become independent so his mother can live more peacefully and he can help her.
